article:
Eric Brown was one of my best friends who was crazy about mountains. Climbing was the   _  of his life. Church towers, seaside cliffs , rock faces, ice mountains, anything "If it is there", he used to say, "then I want to climb it."
So the news of his marriage gave me a 37 _  . I'd never known him to take much interest in  _  . Well, Eric Brown, a married man! I couldn't   _   it. I   _  whether his wife would try to stop some of his risky  _    .
She was French perhaps--from that  _  where he usually spent his holidays. Chamonix, wasn't it? From Chamonix he'd climbed Mount Blanc on his seventeenth birthday, and another one the day after! That was it, then: She was French, from a mountaineering family. No 43. _  No other explanation.
A month later I met them44 _ in town. Anna surprised me--because she was English. She was a dancer in the     _  . "I have  _   climbed more than sixty steps in my life," she told me. "Eric has his   _  , and I've got mine. No48" _ . "None at all." Eric said, smiling. "Where did you spend your  honeymoon  ?" I asked. Somewhere far   _  theatres and mountains, was it? "We had a week's holiday," Anna said, "I flew to New York to see Dirke Dancers on Broadway. A wonderful51 _ !" Eric said: "I didn't want to 52 _  the good weather. So I went to Switzerland and climbed the north 53 _ of the Eiger with Allen Dunlop. Great54 _ , the Eiger. Grand place for a honeymoon! I'll show you the55 _ we took one day."
